29466.name: Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level Calculator
29466.description:
Measure readability of your copy with this Flesch-Kincaid grade level calculator. Select a text layer, and then open the plug-in.


The Flesch Reading Ease Readability Formula is a general formula suitable for all kind of texts. It's especially great for:


  • Writing copy for your website
  • Writing copy for user interfaces
  • Advertising your product
  • Writing headlines and taglines
  • Producing terms and conditions that donâ€™t confuse
  • Boosting your SEO performance
  • Communicating your research to a non-specialist audience


Simply select copy with punctuation to receive your score.


Changelog

V0.1 - Initial Release

V0.2 - Added warning pop-up if all or some of copy selected does not have punctuation

29167.name: Status Changer
29167.description:
Status Changer allows you to easily change the name of the person in charge and the modified date on your own Component set.


HOW TO USE

  1. Install `Status Changer` and run it inside of a project.
  2. Edit the Component Set created for the Status bar.(Note whether the item has been added to Variants.)
  3. Select the Frames, etc. to which you want to add a status bar and run Status Changer.
  4. You can select your own customized component set values, and the status bar(s) will be added when you select and press the SET button.
  5. After changing the status, click "Change user name and modification time." from the plugin in the properties screen on the right.


About Dates and Dates

Multiple country formats are supported, including American and British, Asian, etc.


Sample For January 2, 2022 at 11:03 p.m.


For the British "DD/MM/YY H.mm a" 02/01/22 11.03 pm

For the U.S. "MM-DD-YY H:mm a" 01-02-22 11:03 pm

For the Japan "YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm" 2022/01/02 23:03

Click Here For More Info! 


Caution

Be sure to place it directly below the page.

Do not rename the properties.

relaunchButtons.name: Change user name and modification time

29400.name: Auto Layout Shortcuts
29400.description: Adds menu items for common auto layout commands so they can be assigned to keyboard shortcuts in your OS.

29513.name: Qualas Tracking Plan
29513.description:
Set up your data tracking, send it to Jira, and monitor implementation, all without ever leaving Figma! ğŸ§°


Event Labels ğŸ�·ï¸� 

Make sure you never miss an important interaction, by labelling events directly on your canvas! Your event properties, tags, platform, status and much more, all at a glance!


Tracking Plan âœ…

All the information your developer needs, in just a few clicks! Includes event properties, interaction screenshots and identifiers, comments, tags and implementation status.


Jira and CSV Export ğŸ“„

Export your tracking plan directly to Jira, in just a few seconds! Updates sync with your Figma tracking plan, so it doubles as a dashboard!


ğŸ�¬ Check out our video to see how it works: https://youtu.be/_FlHCxq9Cq0

ğŸŒ� Find out more on our website: https://www.qualas.io

29581.name: Scribble Pal
29581.description:
Scribble Pal is a tiny yet useful utility, especially made for designers using FigJam on iPad with Apple Pencil.


This plugin allows you to create new stickies with text, as well as modify unformatted text on a selected sticky or shape. The large text writing area works with either a keyboard or Apple Pencil with Scribble enabled.


New: Use "Set Anchor" on an existing sticky to set it as the origin point for additional stickies you want to add.


Important Note: This plugin may not work with stickies/shapes that contain formatted text, such as bold and strikethrough. In some cases, you may lose all formatting when updating text.
29581.release_notes: â€¢ Tweaked UX for setting an anchor

29440.name: Suggested Links
29440.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a probabilistic supervised classifier and an integer programming solver to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content and color composition. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Assignment-Based Link Optimization in GUI Prototyping Using Incremental Supervised Classification" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([classifier](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-classifier), [optimizer](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-optimizer), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links), [paper](https://github.com/christophajohns/gui-links-as-assignment)).

29565.name: Position
29565.description: Set position and constraints with margin to center or corners.

28529.name: weblate integration
28529.description:
a plugin that checks for strings on weblate (translation tool) so design copy is updated with all website relevant locale data.


it integrates weblate self-hosted API to quality check design texts on figma and suggest possible already translated strings.

29322.name: Webhook Configurator
29322.description:
Create & manage your team's webhooks.


You can...

  • create webhooks for teams
  • show a list of webhooks for your teams
  • remove webhooks


Requirements

  • To manage a team's webhooks you need to be at least an administrator for that team.
  • You need to have a "Personal Access Token" (within Figma go to your avatar -> settings)
  • The team ID of the team for which to manage webhooks (currently only accessible from the browser version)


Notes

  • This plugin will receive more features/updates.
  • Webhooks are currently in Beta.
  • I'm not a designer myself. So pardon me for the horrible cover art/icon ğŸ˜…


Having feedback or questions? Just let me know ğŸ™‚


==FAQ==


Where do i find my Team ID's?

  1. Open your browser and navigate to Figma.
  2. On the left side select the team (click on it's name; don't select a project)
  3. In the browser's URL bar you can find the Team ID. It is right behind "...team/". E.g. https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234567890/xxx?fuid=8934... => Team ID is 1234567890
29322.release_notes:
- All event types are supported (File update, file version update, file deletion, file comments, library publishing).
- The event type can be selected from a dropdown.
- Improved error handling: users are shown toasts with some instructions.
- If creating a hook fails users are not navigated away anymore.
- Code cleanup & minor UI improvements
